tokens.t: But Job answered and said,

verses.plain: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?

tokens.t: How hast thou helped
without power?
savest thou the arm
no strength?

verses.plain: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?

tokens.t: How hast thou counselled
no wisdom? and
hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?

verses.plain: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?

tokens.t: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?

verses.plain: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

tokens.t: Dead
are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

verses.plain: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.

tokens.t: Hell
naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.

verses.plain: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

tokens.t: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place,
hangeth the earth upon nothing.

verses.plain: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

tokens.t: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

verses.plain: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.

tokens.t: He holdeth back the face of his throne,
spreadeth his cloud upon it.

verses.plain: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.

tokens.t: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.

verses.plain: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.

tokens.t: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.

verses.plain: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.

tokens.t: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.

verses.plain: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.

tokens.t: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.

verses.plain: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?

tokens.t: Lo, these
parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?

footnotes.text: and the…: or, with the inhabitants
until…: Heb. until the end of light with darkness
